required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Optimizing an Online Motivational Tobacco Cessation Program

brief_summary.textblock: The current study tested the effectiveness of four potentially important tailoring factors (decisional framework, self-efficacy, navigation autonomy, and proactive outreach) in the context of an online motivational intervention for smoking cessation. A fifth factor was originally planned by dropped during intervention development due to confounds with the other planned factors. Information learned from this study will inform how to best design an online interventions for smoking cessation. Participants were recruited from a large, regional U.S. health plan. Using a full factorial design to screen for important main effects and 2-way interactions, participants were randomized to receive one of 16 different experimental factor combinations and followed for one year to assess program impact on smokers' use of empirically-validated cessation treatment and abstinence.

detailed_description.textblock: The current study is a factorial screening experiment, consistent with the Multiphase Optimization Strategy. Participants were randomly assigned to one of 16 different combinations of the 4 experimental factors. Each factor was explored on 2 contrasting levels. Each contrasting factor level was then compared to the other, resulting in 4 analytic arms. Within each arm, all participants (n = 1865) were analyzed to determine the relative effect of each contrasting factor level on the primary and secondary outcomes of interest.

primary_outcome.description: confirmed use of pharmacotherapy or enrollment in health plan-sponsored counseling program

arm_group.description: Prescriptive or Motivational Persons are randomized to receive intervention content written in either a prescriptive or motivational tone.
Persons are randomized to receive a personally tailored testimonial or not.

Dictated or Non-Dictated Persons are randomly assigned to be able to freely navigate the website or to have their navigation of the website pre-determined based on their baseline readiness to quit smoking.
Email or No-Email communication Persons are randomized to receive periodic email reminders to return to the intervention website or not.

intervention.description: All participants receive an tailored, online smoking cessation program. Participants in this intervention group either receive content written in a prescriptive tone or a motivational tone.
Persons in this arm either have their ability to navigate the site dictated for them based on their readiness to quit smoking or they are able to freely navigate through the website.
Persons receive periodic, proactively delivered email reminders to visit the intervention website.
People receive a personally-tailored testimonial as part of their online smoking cessation program.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Member of Group Health Cooperative
- Currently Smoking at Least 5 Cigarettes/Day
- Access to Email and the Internet
- Read and Write English
- 18 years or older
- Not currently receiving tobacco cessation treatment
- Capable of participating in online and phone surveys
Exclusion Criteria:
- Persons will be excluded if they do not meet above criteria

reference.citation: McClure JB, Derry H, Riggs KR, Westbrook EW, St John J, Shortreed SM, Bogart A, An LC. Questions about quitting (Q2): design and methods of a Multiphase Optimization Strategy (MOST) randomized screening experiment for an online, motivational smoking cessation intervention. Contemp Clin Trials. 2012 Sep;33(5):1094-102. doi: 10.1016/j.cct.2012.06.009. Epub 2012 Jul 4. Erratum in: Contemp Clin Trials. 2013 May;35(1):179-80.

results_reference.citation: McClure JB, Shortreed SM, Bogart A, Derry H, Riggs K, St John J, Nair V, An L. The effect of program design on engagement with an internet-based smoking intervention: randomized factorial trial. J Med Internet Res. 2013 Mar 25;15(3):e69. doi: 10.2196/jmir.2508.

McClure JB, Peterson D, Derry H, Riggs K, Saint-Johnson J, Nair V, An L, Shortreed SM. Exploring the "active ingredients" of an online smoking intervention: a randomized factorial trial. Nicotine Tob Res. 2014 Aug;16(8):1129-39. doi: 10.1093/ntr/ntu057. Epub 2014 Apr 11.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from Group Health, a large, non-profit health plan in the US Pacific Northwest. Data were collected between May 2010 and November 2012. All intervention and data collection occurred online.

group.description: Persons in this group are randomized to the following combination of each of the experimental factors: message tone [prescriptive], navigation [dictated], proactive emails [yes], and testimonials [yes]

baseline.population: 1865 participants were enrolled and randomized. For the analyses, participants assigned to each contrasting level of each of the 4 experimental factors were compared against one another. Thus, 1865 people were in each analytic arm in this factorial screening experiment.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Smoking Abstinence
outcome.population: Missing data imputed, so all enrolled participants were included in the final intent to treat analytic sample.

group.title: Message Tone: Prescriptive
group.description: Persons in the 'active' comparison group received website content written in a prescriptive message tone. Persons in the comparison group received content written in a motivational message tone.

group.title: Testimonials
group.description: Persons in the 'active' comparison group were randomized to receive a personally tailored testimonial. Persons in the comparison group did not receive the testimonial content.

group.title: Navigation: Dictated
group.description: Persons in the 'active' comparison group had their navigation through the website dictated based on their baseline readiness to quit smoking. Persons in the comparison group could freely navigate the website.

group.title: Proactive Outreach
group.description: Persons in the active comparison group were randomized to receive periodic email reminders to return to the intervention website. Persons in the comparison group did not receive proactive email reminders.

measure.title: Smoking Abstinence
measure.population: Missing data imputed, so all enrolled participants were included in the final intent to treat analytic sample.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to Prescriptive message tone (n = 932) against persons assigned to Motivational message tone (n = 933).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for smoking abstinence at 12 months in intent to treat sample. Participants receiving content written in a Prescriptive tone were compared against persons receiving content in a Motivational tone (ref group).

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to Testimonials (n = 933) against persons assigned to receive no testimonials (n = 932).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for smoking abstinence at 12 months when persons who randomly received a Testimonial were compared against persons receiving No Testimonial (ref group).

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to the Dictated Navigation arm (n = 934) against persons assigned to assigned free navigation of the website (n = 931).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for smoking abstinence at 12 months when persons assigned to Dictated navigation were compared to those not assigned to Dictated navigation (ref group).

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to Proactive Email Outreach (n = 933) against persons assigned to receive No Proactive Email Outreach (n = 932).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for smoking abstinence at 12 months when persons assigned to receive Proactive Email reminders were compared against persons who received No Emails (ref group).

outcome.title: Treatment Utilization for Smoking Cessation
outcome.description: confirmed use of pharmacotherapy or enrollment in health plan-sponsored counseling program
outcome.population: Twenty-seven participants were excluded for not being enrolled in the health plan during the study period and not having access to the provided adjunct treatment.

group.title: Message Tone: Prescriptive
group.description: Persons in the 'active' comparison group received website content written in a prescriptive message tone. Persons in the comparison group received content written in a motivational message tone.

group.title: Testimonials
group.description: Persons in the 'active' comparison group were randomized to receive a personally tailored testimonial. Persons in the comparison group did not receive the testimonial content.

group.title: Navigation: Dictated
group.description: Persons in the 'active' comparison group had their navigation through the website dictated based on their baseline readiness to quit smoking. Persons in the comparison group could freely navigate the website.

group.title: Proactive Emails
group.description: Persons in the active comparison group were randomized to receive periodic email reminders to return to the intervention website. Persons in the comparison group did not receive proactive email reminders.

measure.title: Treatment Utilization for Smoking Cessation
measure.description: confirmed use of pharmacotherapy or enrollment in health plan-sponsored counseling program
measure.population: Twenty-seven participants were excluded for not being enrolled in the health plan during the study period and not having access to the provided adjunct treatment.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to Prescriptive message tone (n = 932) against persons assigned to Motivational message tone (n = 933).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for use of adjunct treatment at 12 months when persons assigned to Prescriptive Tone were compared to persons assigned to receive content in a Motivational Tone (ref group).

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to Testimonials (n = 933) against persons assigned to receive no testimonials (n = 932).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for use of adjunct treatment at 12 months when persons assigned to receive a Testimonial were compared to persons assigned to receive No Testimonial (ref group).

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to the Dictated Navigation arm (n = 934) against persons assigned to assigned free navigation of the website (n = 931).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for use of adjunct treatment at 12 months when persons assigned to Dictated Navigation were compared to persons not assigned to Dictated Navigation (ref group).

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of persons assigned to Proactive Email Outreach (n = 933) against persons assigned to receive No Proactive Email Outreach (n = 932).
analysis.estimate_desc: OR for use of adjunct treatment at 12 months when persons assigned to Proactive Email reminders were compared to persons not assigned to receive Proactive Email reminders (ref group).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were monitored from May 2010 until November 2012, the time during which participants were actively enrolled in this trial.
reported_events.desc: Participants were instructed to contact study staff in the event of adverse events, including changes in their health or medical status. Other potential adverse events (e.g., breach of confidentiality) were monitored by study staff.

group.title: Message Tone
group.description: Prescriptive or Motivational Persons are randomized to receive intervention content written in either a prescriptive or motivational tone.

group.title: Testimonials
group.description: Testimonial or No Testimonial Persons are randomized to receive a personally tailored testimonial or not.

group.title: Navigation
group.description: Dictated or Non-Dictated Persons are randomly assigned to be able to freely navigate the website or to have their navigation of the website pre-determined based on their baseline readiness to quit smoking.

group.title: Proactive Outreach
group.description: Email or No-Email communication Persons are randomized to receive periodic email reminders to return to the intervention website or not.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was powered to detect differences between each factor level of 5% or more.
